alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island Interior; Big Island North; Big Island Southeast; Big Island Summit; Kohala; Molokai Windward (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 17 at 3:37PM HST until further notice by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR MAUI AND HAWAII COUNTIES... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Maui, Molokai, Lanai, Kahoolawe, and the Big Island. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flood prone roads and other low lying areas may be closed due to elevated runoff and overflowing streams. Urban areas may receive more significant flooding and property damage due to rapid runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical Storm Calvin will produce periods of heavy rainfall over all islands in Maui and Hawaii Counties from Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon. Excessive rainfall may lead to flooding conditions and landslides over steep terrain, especially along east and southeast facing slopes.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
